instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.WS_KBD_ONOFF_L: What is WS_KBD_ONOFF_L? WS_KBD_ONOFF_L is a signal that comes from the keyboard that tells the SMC that the power button has been pressed.  L means whatever before the L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. This signal directly affects SMC_ONOFF_L.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard / mouse
threads.message:
Hi Guys I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that we repaired before, liquid damage. That time we fixed the SC-Card reader which was stopping the mac from booting, replaced a resistor and all was OK (also cleaned with ultrasonic cleaner). Now few month later both trackpad and keyboard dont work, mac boots to login screen. We tried all combinations of new KBD/Trackpad nothing worked so assume its a logic board issue. HWT says there might be an issue with Mouse/KBD/Thunderbold. I checked the voltages on KBD and Mouse connector and all are present: 5V, 3.42v and 3.3v. Any idea what i should check more?

EDIT:  <SIGNAL>WS_KBD_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard / mouse
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard / mouse
threads.message: Yes have 3.3v on pin 22 and 49 from <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>. R also have the correct ohm values. Have 3.3 also on <SIGNAL>TPAD_VBUS_EN</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard / mouse
threads.message:
Known good trackpad? Bad trackpad will also mess up the keyboard. Check in OSX if the keyboard/trackpad are listed under USB devices.
Also diode mode on the trackpad connector. Check for corroded traces.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard / mouse
threads.message: It was a corroded trace, thanks duke! Can be closed.
